title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 05 April 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:46 <jssolichin> has joined #xwiki  
01:29 <polx> has quit  
01:43 <jssolichin> has quit

08:49 <+tmortagne> completing the release note with things that are still missing and will announce it  
08:52 <vmassol> tmortagne: jerome needs to add the LDP stuff in it too. I've pinged him yesterday  
08:53 <ssavi> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yep that's among the thing I was planning to add to the RN, the maven release has been done two days  ago, can't wait forever  
08:53 <vmassol> he needs to create an extension entry on e.x.o and then link it and add a scrneesht in the RN  
08:53 <vmassol> tmortagne: yep go ahead  
08:53 <vmassol> I'll continue pushing jerome for the doc today  
08:54 <+tmortagne> will just do the RN foor now with a few lines and a screenshot  
08:54 <vmassol> yep  
08:54 <vmassol> sounds good  
08:54 <vmassol> I need to check them too  
08:54 <vmassol> the ircbotapp should be in there too  
08:54 <vmassol> checking now  
08:54 <+tmortagne> not starting well, I can't fing any LDAP entry in the admin menu  
08:55 <vmassol> have you installed it?  
08:55 <vmassol> it's not bundled by default  
08:55 <+tmortagne> I downloaded the jetty/hsqldb 4.0M2  
08:55 <+tmortagne> ha ?  
08:55 <vmassol> you need to install it with the EM  
08:55 <vmassol> FTM  
08:55 <+tmortagne> ok  
08:55 <vmassol> it's then for us to decide if we want it by default or not  
08:56 <vmassol> I'm not sure myself  
08:56 <vmassol> I'm leaning towards option  
08:56 <vmassol> now that it's easy to add stuff with the EM  
08:56 <vmassol> and since we want to slim down XE  
09:02 <vmassol> I'm updating the RN  
09:03 <vmassol> hope this is not going to cause any issue :)  
09:03 <vmassol> (the attachment addition)  
09:03 <vmassol> probabyl not  
09:03 <+mflorea> vmassol: let me know when you finish  
09:03 <vmassol> ok  
09:04 <vmassol> still reviewing  
09:04 <vmassol> give me 5mn  
09:04 <+mflorea> ok  
09:04 <vmassol> wow the user dir screenshot is way too large  
09:04 <vmassol> we need to ask Eddy to make a smaller version  
09:04 <vmassol> I'd do it but he has some nice content in his wiki it seems  
09:05 <vmassol> it's so large that it's cropped on my display which is already very large ;)  
09:05 <vmassol> moving json tool to developers section  
09:06 <vmassol> mflorea: go ahead, I'll continue adding my changes after  
09:06 <+mflorea> ok  
09:07 <vmassol> sburjan`: good morning, I've added a section for you to fill about tested DBs. Could you fill it please?  
09:09 <vmassol> mflorea: you should maybe add the Appwithininutes improvements somewhere too, wdyt?  
09:12 <+tmortagne> vmassol: we can reduce the size of the image just by setting it for now  
09:12 <+mflorea> vmassol: I will  
09:12 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok  
09:12 <vmassol> the quality will degrade  
09:12 <vmassol> we still need to ask eddy  
09:12 <+tmortagne> hmm LDAP UI is pretty big too  
09:12 <+tmortagne> not sure how to do a screenshot not too big but steel "readable"  
09:13 <+tmortagne> I don't even see half of it with a full HD display  
09:17 <ssavi\_> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <ssavi> has quit  
09:17 <ssavi\_> is now known as <ssavi>  
09:21 <vmassol> FTR I've noticed that I've made a mistake in placing VelocityManager in the velocity module  
09:22 <vmassol> I think it belongs to another module  
09:22 <vmassol> right now it's implementation is in oldcore btw  
09:23 <vmassol> mflorea: we need to reorganiza a bit the documentation  
09:23 <vmassol> I see we have "Checkout the http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting#HVelocitySpecificInformation for detailed information about Velocity scripting within XWiki."  
09:23 <vmassol> it's actually the other way around  
09:23 <vmassol> this page should refer to the module doc for detailed information ;)  
09:24 <vmassol> I'll do it if I get some time later on  
09:25 <+mflorea> vmassol: I wanted to do this, but most of the details there is not specific to Velocity module. i.e. the default bindings like $doc or $xwiki are not done in the Velocity module..  
09:25 <vmassol> ep  
09:25 <vmassol> yep  
09:25 <vmassol> in term of hierarchy it's platform depending on velcoity module  
09:25 <vmassol> I'm making the change now  
09:25 <vmassol> it's not much  
09:25 <+mflorea> ok  
09:28 <+tmortagne> vmassol: is it possible to set the size in the image macro ?  
09:28 <vmassol> no  
09:29 <vmassol> I haven't coded this...  
09:29 <+tmortagne> ok  
09:30 <+tmortagne> note that you could let the user put whatever parameter he want and just filter to one that are meaningfull for the macro itself and put the other as link parameters  
09:32 <vmassol> we really need to start publishing javadocs with maven site  
09:32 <vmassol> ah no  
09:32 <+tmortagne> vmassol: what maximum height to you think would be the best ? it's the full size right now  
09:32 <vmassol> they're arleady published  
09:32 <vmassol> in nexus  
09:32 <vmassol> :)  
09:32 <+tmortagne> yep  
09:33 <+tmortagne> but it's a bit less accessible than a maven site  
09:33 <vmassol> ah yes I remember now  
09:33 <vmassol> we wanted to add a javadoc field to extensions  
09:33 <vmassol> is it available tmortagne?  
09:33 <vmassol> I need to add javadoc to the velocity module  
09:34 <+tmortagne> vmassol: there is none right now  
09:34 <+tmortagne> but it's not hard to add  
09:34 <vmassol> ok I'll do it manually in the doc content for now  
09:34 <vmassol> but would be nice to add one  
09:35 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'd like to import data from the mavne repo for the velocity module page. Can you remind me where's the script?  
09:35 <+tmortagne> vmassol: you have a link on the home page  
09:36 <vmassol> ok  
09:36 <+tmortagne> (in the contribute extension box)  
09:37 <vmassol> trying...  
09:37 <vmassol> ouch  
09:37 <vmassol> Failed to import extension: class java.lang.NullPointerException: null  
09:37 <vmassol>     at org.xwiki.extension.repository.xwiki.internal.DefaultRepositoryManager.importExtension(DefaultRepositoryManager.java:471)  
09:37 <vmassol>     at org.xwiki.extension.repository.xwiki.internal.RepositoryScriptService.importExtension(RepositoryScriptService.java:100)  
09:37 <vmassol> here's the url:  
09:37 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ExtensionCode/ImportExtension?parent=Extension.WebHome&template=ExtensionCode.ExtensionTemplate&importExtension=true&extensionId=org.xwiki.commons%3Axwiki-commons-velocity&repositoryId=maven-xwiki  
09:40 <vmassol> Denis: ping  
09:40 <+tmortagne> I used it for other extensions on extensions.xwiki.org so it's weird, will have to check 3.5 source to understand  
09:40 <vmassol> Denis: would be nice to add the new right simplementation in the RN and explain how to try it out  
09:40 <vmassol> (and explain what it does, why we have a new implementation)  
09:41 <vmassol> (we need a Rights Module on e.x.o for that too)  
09:42 <vmassol> Denis: we should also add liquibase to the RN  
09:42 <vmassol> (in developer section)  
09:43 <vmassol> Denis: and the new doc ids and migration  
09:44 <vmassol> tmortagne: and the new CM feature in the developer section i think  
09:44 <vmassol> (which needs to be documented in the Component Module too)  
09:44 <+tmortagne> vmassol: what new CM feature ?  
09:44 <vmassol> type support  
09:44 <+tmortagne> that was in M1  
09:44 <vmassol> ok so it's documented?  
09:46 <+tmortagne> in the M1 RN yes, not yet has time to update the module documentation  
09:46 <+tmortagne> had  
09:46 <vmassol> just tried to import a non existing module and it failed too with the same problem: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ExtensionCode/ImportExtension?parent=Extension.WebHome&template=ExtensionCode.ExtensionTemplate&importExtension=true&extensionId=org.xwiki.commons%3Axwiki-commons-text&repositoryId=maven-xwiki  
09:47 <ssavi> has quit  
09:49 <rrodriguez> has quit  
09:54 <vmassol> mflorea: btw when creating a new module you can use the UI from the Extension home page :)  
09:54 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <+mflorea> vmassol: ok, I just took the link you gave me for Velocity Module and start from there :)  
09:59 <vmassol> yep I know  
09:59 <vmassol> ;)  
09:59 <vmassol> you missed setting the parent hwich is set automatically by the home page UI ;)  
10:00 <+mflorea> hmm, indeed, I checked the objects of another module, but forgot about the parent..  
10:00 <+tmortagne> I would like to restart xwiki.org, is it ok for everyone ?  
10:01 <vmassol> wait  
10:01 <vmassol> I need to fix something first  
10:01 <vmassol> the import messed up a few stuff  
10:02 <vmassol> hmmm  
10:02 <vmassol> I don't see how it can have messed up stuff  
10:02 <vmassol> since there's no history version  
10:02 <+tmortagne> seems weird since it failed before saving anything according to the error  
10:03 <vmassol> ok so it changed  
10:03 <vmassol> but not saved  
10:03 <vmassol> it must be in the cache  
10:03 <+tmortagne> hmm maybe  
10:03 <vmassol> not very nice … ;)  
10:03 <vmassol> ok I'm good for restart then  
10:36 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
10:43 <vmassol> mflorea: nice image showing incompatible deps :)  
10:43 <vmassol> (hadn't seen it)  
10:43 <+mflorea> thanks :)  
10:43 <vmassol> however why can we click on install?  
10:43 <vmassol> shouldn't it be greyed out?  
10:44 <vmassol> or is it to force the install?  
10:45 <vmassol> also what does "provided" means in the 3rd image?  
10:45 <+mflorea> the install button should be disabled I think, the EM doesn't allow to upgrade core extensions  
10:45 <+mflorea> provided means bundled with XWiki Enteprise  
10:45 <vmassol> hmm ok, wasn't clear to me when reading  
10:46 <vmassol> shouldn't it be installed?  
10:46 <+mflorea> nop, those extensions are not installed  
10:46 <+mflorea> there is a difference between an extension installed by the user and one that comes with XE  
10:47 <+mflorea> well, by "installed" we mean something that the user really installed, by clicking the install button  
10:48 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: the ow2 password in the password file does not seems to be taken into account by push-release script  
10:48 <+tmortagne> not for the scp at least  
10:49 <+mflorea> yes.. I had to enter it for each artifact too..  
10:49 <+mflorea> a bit anoying  
10:49 <vmassol> mflorea: yes I know but we need to think from a user POV. I'm not sure provided means anything for me  
10:49 <vmassol> s/me/them  
10:50 <vmassol> "Installed (Core Extension)"?  
10:50 <+mflorea> well, there are a few differences: (1) you can't uninstall "provided" extension, but you can uninstall "installed" extensions. (2) same with upgrade. You can't upgrade core extensions  
10:51 <+mflorea> for me "installed" suggests that it can be uninstalled  
10:51 <+mflorea> that's why I preferred not to display installed for core extensions  
10:58 <+mflorea> vmassol: I haven't read very carefully your comment about the install button. I can't gray it out. I mean, it's not that simple. In this particular case the conflict is on a direct dependency, but in general, the conflict/incompatibility can be on a transitive dependency at any level, so without creating the install plan I can't know if the extension can be installed or not. Ofc, I can handle direct dependencies specially, but I'd rather not..  
10:59 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:59 <+fmancinelli> Hello all  
11:06 <savee> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <vmassol> LDAP UI screenshot is very small…. maybe we can make it clickable?  
11:10 <vmassol> (in the RN)  
11:11 <vmassol> there are still a lot of stuff to add to the RN  
11:11 <vmassol> can I take ownership?  
11:11 <vmassol> (to add my stuff)  
11:15 <+tmortagne> vmassol: do I have a lock on it ?  
11:15 <vmassol> nope

11:25 <vmassol> (adding it now)

11:26 <+sburjan> the other, the committer should say a few words about it because I don't know the details

11:28 <+sburjan> that's the only one I'm doing  
11:28 <+sburjan> doing it now  
11:28 <vmassol> ah ok I misundrstood what you meant then by "I will do the Migration part"  
11:29 <+sburjan> nop, not familiar at all with that  
11:29 <+sburjan> I can maintain documentation if I understand the features, but for new features with no doc, I can't do much  
11:30 <vmassol> why did you say: "I will do the Migration part" ?  
11:30 <+sburjan> my fault. I was saying the Database part  
11:31 <+sburjan> that's a huge list of removed API's we have here  
11:31 <vmassol> it's quite small actually  
11:31 <vmassol> for a 4.x release  
11:32 <vmassol> I need to conclude on the deprecation and removal strategy email thread  
11:32 <+sburjan> yes, but we can still remove until RC1, right ?  
11:32 <vmassol> remove what?  
11:33 <+sburjan> remove more API's :)  
11:33 <vmassol> tmortagne: your mail is a bit low on details IMO  
11:33 <vmassol> we have a lot of new stuff  
11:33 <vmassol> I'm not excited by the mail  
11:33 <vmassol> also  
11:33 <vmassol> we need to make people try the new rights modue  
11:34 <vmassol> so we need to advertise this  
11:35 <vmassol> but ok, I know why you're not in the marketing domain ;)  
11:35 <+Denis> vmassol: sorry, I could not do that today  
11:35 <+Denis> I am off all day  
11:35 <vmassol> Denis: yesterday then?  
11:35 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I forgot about new rights module since there is not a single jira issue about it  
11:35 <vmassol> Denis: it's not like this is a surprise  
11:35 <vmassol> :)  
11:35 <vmassol> we've been planning this release for several weeks ;)  
11:36 <vmassol> Denis: no jira????  
11:36 <vmassol> we talked about it  
11:36 <+Denis> jira for ?  
11:36 <vmassol> new rights module  
11:36 <+Denis> there was, and it was closed  
11:36 <vmassol> tmortagne: maybe you missed it?  
11:37 <vmassol> found it: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5267  
11:37 <vmassol> missing an affects btw  
11:37 <vmassol> fixing  
11:37 <+tmortagne> when you look at the module history there is no jira issue associated  
11:37 <vmassol> just fixed the component too  
11:37 <+Denis> tmortagne: missed to add it in the merge commit  
11:38 <+tmortagne> I quickly search for "security" on jira but it was not returning so i assumed there was nothing  
11:38 <vmassol> tmortagne: congrats for the tweet. It worked this time :)  
11:38 <vmassol> first time I see it done right :)  
11:39 <+Denis> vmassol: regarding docid, there is information in the M1 release  
11:39 <vmassol> Denis: ah it wasn't done in m2?  
11:39 <vmassol> my bad then,  I'll remove the section  
11:39 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yes that's the main M1 new thing  
11:39 <+Denis> no, in M2, only the merge of the right module  
11:40 <vmassol> I don't see it in m1  
11:40 <vmassol> only in the migration section  
11:40 <vmassol> ok fixing RN for m2  
11:40 <+Denis> right, this is a migration issue, and internal for the rest, no really a feature to explains  
11:41 <vmassol> done  
11:41 <+Denis> for the security component, I propose to be better in RC1  
11:42 <vmassol> wdym Denis?  
11:42 <vmassol> we still need to document it in the RN for M2  
11:42 <vmassol> and ask people to try it out IMO  
11:43 <+Denis> but I have to leave right now...  
11:43 <vmassol> ok please add the information as soon as you can  
11:44 <Rajan\_Mistry> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <+Denis> ok, bye  
11:45 <Denis> has quit

11:54 <vmassol> (I don't recall seeing that)

12:01 <polx> I very much interested

12:01 <savee> oh  
12:01 <savee> .k  
12:01 <polx> ;-)

12:02 <savee> :)

12:09 <polx> Savee: the same?  
12:09 <savee> polx: Yes

12:16 <savee> may be a new branch like feature-solr-search

18:21 <CIA-120> tmortagne master \* rb477b09 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/b477b0917d91dd6bf0898a92f00119aa61c5cecd / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-repositories/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki-server-ui/src/main/resources/ExtensionCode/SkinExtension.xml : XWIKI-7694: Improve XR home page display when not logged in ...  
18:21 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:34 <@sdumitriu> jvdrean: Why not?  
18:35 <+jvdrean> sdumitriu: I don't see why we'd have form values in the context since we're calling the edit action  
18:36 <+jvdrean> in Save\*Action it's obvious but in EditAction ? What am I missing ?  
18:37 <@sdumitriu> Being able to pass URL parameters from a create form  
18:37 <+jvdrean> right  
18:37 <+jvdrean> I have an issue with this now that I'm trying to expose doc.hidden in the UI  
18:39 <+jvdrean> when dealing with strings it's easy to ignore a parameter when it is null  
18:39 <+jvdrean> we can do "if (syntaxId != null) { do something }"  
18:41 <+jvdrean> but with a checkbox I can't do this, since an unchecked checkbox will result in "request.getParameter("mycheckbox") == null"  
18:41 <vmassol> bbiab  
18:42 <+jvdrean> I need 3 states, absent from the request / set to false in the request / set to true in the request  
18:46 <+jvdrean> I guess I could add a hidden input along with my checkbox and take the request value into account only when this other param is present  
18:46 <+jvdrean> but it feels wrong  
18:47 <+jvdrean> sdumitriu: WDYT ?  
18:48 <@sdumitriu> jvdrean: For the other checkboxes we use a checkbox and a hidden input  
18:48 <@sdumitriu> with 0 as the value  
18:48 <@sdumitriu> getParameter will return 1, the value of the checkbox, when it is selected, or 0, the value from the hidden input, when the checkbox is unchecked  
18:49 <@sdumitriu> getParameterValues will return either [0] or [1, 0], so 0 is always sent in the request  
18:49 <@sdumitriu> Just that the checkbox will override it when needed  
18:50 <+jvdrean> is it guaranteed that getParameter will return 1 when the checkbox is checked ?  
18:51 <@sdumitriu> Unfortunately, the servlet spec isn't clear here  
18:51 <@sdumitriu> In practice I've never seen it fail  
18:52 <+jvdrean> so in practice the latest html elements is first in the list of parameter values  
18:52 <@sdumitriu> Well, not always, you have to put the two inputs in the right order in the HTML  
18:52 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:53 <@sdumitriu> And it's the other way around  
18:53 <@sdumitriu> The checkbox must be first  
18:54 <@sdumitriu> The request contains the form values in the order they are seen in the form  
18:54 <+jvdrean> yes that's what I got with a small test  
18:54 <+jvdrean> ok I'll do this, thanks!\
